metadata.titel_preek: On the Wrong Side of the Ditch . . . for a Long Time

kernfrasen: used up your quotas of good stuff
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: DIVINE JUSTICE IS AN ULTIMATE CALCULUS

cognitieve_implicaties: Safety is found in belonging to a lineage/family
God's presence is tactile and protective
ethische_implicaties: The marginalized are the true heirs of the family home

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes this dead metaphor by contrasting it with the 'cold mountain' of Moses and the 'burning lips' of the rich man.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the tension between the 'Abraham' (Relational) and 'Moses' (Juridical) domains as a deliberate rhetorical strategy rather than a failure of logic.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The 'no questions asked' embrace of Abraham conflicts with the 'harsh, revolutionary requirements' of Moses.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Unconditional love vs. Conditional covenantal obedience.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher blends the 'ghost story' (haunting) with 'accounting' (calculus) to suggest that economic choices have spiritual 'weight' that follows one into the afterlife.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the source domain of 'Abraham's Bosom' by emphasizing physical warmth and contrast with the 'ditch'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Rock-a my Soul in the Bosom of Abraham.

risicos.beschrijving: The spatial metaphor of the 'ditch' might lead to a literalistic view of a fixed, unchangeable hell that ignores other biblical metaphors of reconciliation.
risicos.voorbeeld: There the ditch is. It’s settled now.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Fatalism or despair regarding the possibility of repentance.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A starkly divided landscape consisting of a banquet hall and a ditch/gate.
sub_worlds: The world of the 'Five Brothers' (The Present)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective; it forces the hearer to realize they are currently in the 'warning' phase.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By framing the rich man's wealth as a 'temporary social role' that lacks a name.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Introducing the 'harsh, cold' Moses and the 'terrible storyteller' Jesus.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as the Sovereign Rearranger of Reality.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligned with the Lectionary's prophetic tradition.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by Spatial (Ditch/Side) and Relational (Father/Child) metaphors. It successfully avoids 'therapeutic reduction' by leaning into the harshness of the Military/Juridical domain of Moses. However, it relies heavily on the 'Economic' domain to explain justice, which risks making salvation seem like a zero-sum game of 'quotas'.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the source domain by describing the 'ditch' as something dug by the rich man's own indifference during life.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The ditch was dug one ignored crumb at a time.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly state that the 'if' of Moses is the protection of the 'embrace' of Abraham for the poor.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests God has a limited supply of 'good stuff'.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that the 'quota' refers to the rich man's consumption, not God's capacity to give.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To show how we build walls that become our own prisons in the afterlife.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to disrupt comfortable schemas. The 'haunting' metaphor in the conclusion is particularly powerful.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Focuses on the cognitive mapping of 'The Ditch' rather than just the beauty of the prose.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Analyzes the conceptual architecture of the 'Bosom' rather than just the experiential learning cycle.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals how the preacher uses the 'Container' schema (Bosom vs. Hades) to define theological identity.

appendices.notities: The preacher (Brueggemann) uses CMT to bridge the gap between ancient text and modern economic reality.
